intro: Thamnojusticia grandiflora, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking red, tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has thick, fleshy stems and leaves, adapted to thrive in arid environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance. Thamnojusticia grandiflora is also known for its ability to attract hummingbirds and other pollinators.
